guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: All contributors should adhere to the community’s code of conduct to ensure a respectful and inclusive environment. This is crucial as it fosters a positive collaborative space.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: Report any issues you encounter using the project's issue tracker. This helps maintainers become aware of and address bugs or feature requests, thus improving the project.

guidelines.title: Pull Request Process
guidelines.description: Follow the established pull request process including proper documentation and tests for new features. This ensures that contributions are well-integrated and maintain the project's integrity.

guidelines.title: Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Adhere to the project's coding standards and style guides. Consistent code quality and style are important for maintainability and readability.

guidelines.title: Commit Message Guidelines
guidelines.description: Write clear and descriptive commit messages. Good commit messages help in tracking changes and understanding the history of the project.

guidelines.title: Documentation Contributions
guidelines.description: Contributors are encouraged to improve the project’s documentation. Comprehensive documentation supports better user understanding and eases future development.

guidelines.title: Review and Feedback
guidelines.description: Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback. This collaborative review process enhances code quality and knowledge sharing.

guidelines.title: Code Style
guidelines.description: Maintaining consistent code style ensures that the project remains readable and maintainable. Contributors should adhere to the coding standards specified in the documentation.

guidelines.title: Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Well-written commit messages provide context for the changes introduced. Contributors should follow the format and conventions for commit messages to create a clear history of the project’s development.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Submitting pull requests for contributions allows for review and discussion of code changes. Contributors should ensure their pull requests are well-documented and pass all tests to facilitate smooth integration.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: Proper issue reporting helps in tracking bugs and feature requests efficiently. Contributors should use the issue templates provided and include all necessary details to help maintainers understand and address the issues.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Ensuring code changes do not introduce new issues is critical for project stability. Contributors are required to write and run tests for their code changes to confirm they work correctly and do not break existing functionality.

guidelines.title: Documentation
guidelines.description: Comprehensive documentation improves project usability and helps others understand its implementation. Contributors should update or add new documentation related to their changes to keep the project well-documented.

guidelines.title: Code Reviews
guidelines.description: Participating in code reviews is essential for maintaining code quality and sharing knowledge among contributors. Reviewing others’ code and receiving feedback on your own helps in improving the overall quality of the project.

guidelines.title: Branching Model
guidelines.description: Using a consistent branching model for development helps manage parallel development and releases. Contributors should follow the branching strategy outlined in the documentation to keep the project’s development process organized.

guidelines.title: Submit Issues
guidelines.description: If you encounter a bug or have a feature request, submit an issue on the project’s GitHub repository. This helps the maintainers locate and address problems effectively.

guidelines.title: Fork the Repository
guidelines.description: Before making any changes, fork the repository to your own GitHub account. This creates a personal copy of the project where you can freely work without affecting the main repository.

guidelines.title: Create a Feature Branch
guidelines.description: Work on your changes in a separate feature branch. This keeps your work organized and makes it easier to manage different features or fixes concurrently.

guidelines.title: Write Descriptive Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Ensure your commit messages are clear and descriptive. This improves the project's history and makes it easier for others to understand the purpose of your changes.

guidelines.title: Run Tests
guidelines.description: Run all tests to make sure your changes do not break any existing functionality. Testing helps ensure the stability and reliability of the project.

guidelines.title: Submit a Pull Request
guidelines.description: Once your changes are ready, submit a pull request to the main repository. Provide a detailed explanation of what your pull request addresses, and include any relevant information or context.

guidelines.title: Adhere to Code Style Guidelines
guidelines.description: Follow the project's coding style guidelines. This maintains consistency throughout the codebase, making it easier for others to read and understand.
